remarks: Lemma for ~ 2sq .  If a number that is a sum of two squares is divisible by a number whose prime divisors are all sums of two squares, then the quotient is a sum of two squares.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 20-Jun-2015.)
statement:
2sq.1 $e |- S = ran ( w e. Z[i] |-> ( ( abs ` w ) ^ 2 ) ) $.
2sqlem6.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. NN ) $.
2sqlem6.2 $e |- ( ph -> B e. NN ) $.
2sqlem6.3 $e |- ( ph -> A. p e. Prime ( p || B -> p e. S ) ) $.
2sqlem6.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( A x. B ) e. S ) $.
2sqlem6 $p |- ( ph -> A e. S ) $.
$d B p $.
$d S p $.
$d p ph $.
$d p w $.
